spec-template.name: Standard Quint Spec Template
spec-template.description: Complete boilerplate for a new Quint specification following State type + Pure functions + Thin actions pattern
instructions: Replace 'System' with your module name
Define your types in section 1
Add constants in section 2
Implement business logic in pure functions (section 3)
Declare state variables matching State type (section 4)
Add invariants (section 5)
Create thin actions that call pure functions (section 6)
Add action witnesses for reachability testing (section 6.1)
Initialize state with mapBy for maps (section 7)
Configure step action for exploration (section 8)

test-template.name: Quint Test File Template
test-template.description: Template for test file that imports and tests a Quint specification
use_for: Testing specs after main spec is finalized
instructions: Create test file AFTER reviewing main spec
Replace 'system' with your module name
Replace 'System' with your imported module
Update test names and expectations
Start with concrete tests, add non-deterministic tests later
test-template.workflow: Only create test file after reviewing and finalizing the main specification

choreo-template.name: Choreo Spec Template
choreo-template.description: Complete boilerplate for a Choreo-based distributed protocol specification with listeners, messages, and state transitions
includes: Mandatory Choreo types (Node, Message, StateFields, etc.)
instructions: Replace 'ProtocolName' with your protocol name
Define protocol roles in the Role type (section 1)
Define protocol stages in the Stage type (section 1)
Define all message types in the Message type (section 2)
Add protocol-specific fields to StateFields (section 2)
Create helper functions to filter/extract messages (section 4)
Write one listener function per protocol transition (section 5)
Combine all listeners in main_listener (section 6)
Define your nodes and assign roles (section 7)
Initialize each node's state in initialize() (section 8)
Add invariants for safety properties (section 10)
Add witnesses to test listener reachability (section 11)
choreo-template.workflow: Use this template when building distributed protocols that require message passing, Byzantine fault tolerance, or consensus mechanisms

choreo-test-template.name: Choreo Test File Template
choreo-test-template.description: Complete test file boilerplate for Choreo protocol specifications with multiple test scenarios: happy-path, timeouts, message injection, and complex workflows
includes: Test 4: Multi-stage workflow with message extraction
Test 5: Complex scenario with justification sets
Helper patterns for common test operations
instructions: Replace 'protocol' and 'protocolTest' with your module names
Update import parameters (section 1) to match your protocol
Replace 'listener_name', 'action_name' with your actual listener/action names
Replace 'MessageType' with your actual message variant constructors
Update 'ExpectedStage', 'FinalStage' with your protocol stages
Replace 's.system.get(node).field' with your actual state fields
Update 'get_message_type()' with your message extraction helper
Modify test scenarios to match your protocol's behavior
Add/remove tests as needed for your specific protocol
Use helper patterns (section 7) for common operations
choreo-test-template.workflow: Create this test file AFTER your Choreo protocol spec is complete. Use it to test happy paths, timeouts, message injection, and complex multi-stage workflows.
key_patterns: .with_cue(listener, params).perform(action) - Execute specific listener with parameters
.step_with_messages(listener_fn, msg_fn) - Inject messages and filter listeners
.find(predicate).unwrap() - Extract specific messages from message sets
NODES.forall(n => condition) - Verify all nodes satisfy condition
